page.title: 08ATTITUDES
page.content: Conflict of interests in rural area.People want to live in agricultural surroundings but object to inconvenience of farming. Farms being broken up and used as small units, farms amalgamated and hedgerows torn up for arable crops. Farmers resentful of this attitude as farming is their living and must be done efficiently to exit, which entails use of large harvesters for arable crops in large fields and heavy trailers for sillage for dairy herds. Although older inhabitants of villages say it has changed, new people find the village freindly with good community spirit.Closure of village school resented,some say education better in larger units elswhere.Support for Green Belt policies.Cocern about fluoradation. Animal rights.Hunting for/against.
